result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Schumann A Yu Sandstrom

records.addlTxt: Outpatient Competency Restoration Program admission decision with agreement and rules and code of conduct forms attached.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Order of Commitment for Treatment signed by Judge Paul F Reilly September 7, 2022.

9:12 AM; Case called for Review hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Schumann A Yu Sandstrom in court.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Schumann A Yu Sandstrom.  Court notes it received Dr. Collins competency report yesterday and inquires if both parties have received and reviewed the report.  Atty. Nimmer advises she has received the report and reviewed it with her client; they are not contesting Dr. Collins' findings.  State has received and reviewed the report; they are not contesting Dr. Collins' findings.  Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant regarding his waiver of right to contest the competency finding.  Court finds the defendant is knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waiving his right to contest the findings.  Based on Dr. Collins findings as well there being no contest by either party the Court will find the defendant is not competency but likely to become competent with treatment under 971.14(5) and will order treatment.  Court will also refer the defendant to the Outpatient Competency Restoration Program.  Court will adjourn for continued review on treatment to competency in about 90 days.
Review hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
with Cover Sheet for Confidential Records filed by Dr. Collins.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty. Nimmer as counsel of record for the defendant.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Paul Reilly on 8/11/22
Review hearing on September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Signed competency order
The original document name was titled: Proposed competency Order
The original history event date is: 08-05-2022

proposed competency order
The original document name was titled: Proposed competency Order
The original history event date is: 08-05-2022

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is to comply with all of the the conditions in Waukesha County Case No. 22ME321 and the settlement agreement with Health and Human Services.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

02:38 PM Defendant Schumann A Yu Sandstrom in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Niki Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nimmer appears as friend of the court.  Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office as he was under the impression his parents were retaining private counsel.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The defendant's father appears in the gallery indicating the family is working on retaining Attorney Kerri Cleghorn.  THE COURT ORDERS FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.  The Court will set this matter before the Trial Court for a review on competency.  Review hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
